page.title: 09DAIRY FARMING
page.content: Dairy farming is the most popular type of farming around here. Many farms are quite big with around 150 cows, but there are some small holdings with just a few cows. Each cow is recorded and numbered, facts about each are written down, such as when it last had a calf, whether another was due, its age etc.. Each cow is milked twice a day, once in the morning about 6:30am and once in the afternoon about 3:30pm. The amount of milk depends on the type of cow. Most local farms have Fresian cows which produce more good quality milk than most. In an average sized farm they can produce up to, or more than, 2700 litres, but can drop down to 300 litres a day. The milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board in or around Wrexham mainly. Every morning a milk tanker collects the milk.
